channel.title: Java.exe not foundwut?
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/kOhrCrs.png[/img] I've got the environment variables set up, and it seems to literally just ignore them. I've followed several different tutorials, telling me to do several different things, and I've tried every combination of paths I can think of and nothing has worked. I'm on windows 8 (Yes, I hate it too.) is it just not compatible or something?
Compile Server.bat: [code]ERROR: The process "java.exe" not found. Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\li b\tools.jar Buildfile: build.xml
compile: [delete] Deleting: C:\Users\Jonathan\Desktop\EasyRSC\Server - Copy\rscd.jar [mkdir] Created dir: C:\Users\Jonathan\Desktop\EasyRSC\Server - Copy\build [javac] Compiling 167 source files to C:\Users\Jonathan\Desktop\EasyRSC\Serv er - Copy\build
BUILD FAILED C:\Users\Jonathan\Desktop\EasyRSC\Server - Copy\build.xml:13: Unable to find a j avac compiler; com.sun.tools.javac.Main is not on the classpath. Perhaps JAVA_HOME does not point to the JDK. It is currently set to "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7"
Total time: 0 seconds[/code]
Run Server.bat: [code]Buildfile: build.xml
runserver: [java] Error: Could not find or load main class org.rscdaemon.server.Server
[java] Java Result: 1
BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: 0 seconds[/code]

item.title: Java.exe not foundwut?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

i’m half asleep still, ok. lollololol

Read full topic

item.title: Java.exe not foundwut?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“tigerclan, post:11, topic:528568”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=647321.msg4353516#msg4353516 date=1377062125]

thats because easyrsc requires jdk 6
[/quote]NOPPPEEEE. stop saying that. the XStream library has a bug with Java 7+, if you do exactly what the warning says (which is a add a no-argument constructor to each class the engine uses) then you’ll be perfectly fine using Java 7;

edit:
lololol, you can tell i spent the night programming when i end a sentence with a semicolon.

well whatever, either is a solution[/quote]kid goml

Lemony Lime:

It’s not that I don’t want to do it… it’s that I don’t know what it means. I would really rather not roll back to java 6 if I can help it.

A no-constructor is exactly as it sounds.

[code=java]public final class InvItem {
// data memebers

// getters/setters

}[/code]

change it to

public final class InvItem { // data memebers public InvItem() { } // getters/setters }

Read full topic

item.title: Java.exe not foundwut?
item.dc:creator: @Fabrice_L Fabrice L
item.description:
@Fabrice_L wrote:

Lemony Lime:

What do I actually need to do? From searching other threads, it seemed like I needed to update xstream.jar, and I tried several versions of that, getting different errors each time.

imthenull:

the XStream library has a bug with Java 7+, if you do exactly what the warning says (which is a add a no-argument constructor to each class the engine uses) then you’ll be perfectly fine using Java 7;

^^ This is all you should do

And if you don’t want to do this, install java6

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“Lemony Lime, post:5, topic:528568”]I changed the target version in build.xml from 1.5 to 1.7 and it compiled without any errors (other than java.exe not found) and said build was successful. Tried running the server afterward and got this error:

[code]C:\Users\Jonathan\Desktop\EasyRSC\Server>“run server.bat”
Buildfile: build.xml

runserver:
[java] java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError

ava:113)

a:37)

Cannot construct org.rscdaemon.server.model.InvItem as it does not have a no-arg
s constructor

vItem as it does not have a no-args constructor

vItem as it does not have a no-args constructor

.ObjectAccessException
[java] required-type : org.rscdaemon.server.model.InvItem

(TreeUnmarshaller.java:45)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.co
nvertAnother(ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.java:39)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.AbstractColle
ctionConverter.readItem(AbstractCollectionConverter.java:82)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.CollectionCon
verter.populateCollection(CollectionConverter.java:60)

verter.unmarshal(CollectionConverter.java:53)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.convertAnother
(TreeUnmarshaller.java:38)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.co
nvertAnother(ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.java:39)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.AbstractColle
ctionConverter.readItem(AbstractCollectionConverter.java:82)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.ArrayConverte
r.unmarshal(ArrayConverter.java:51)

nvertAnother(ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.java:39)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.start(TreeUnma
rshaller.java:99)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathMarshallingStra
tegy.unmarshal(ReferenceByXPathMarshallingStrategy.java:12)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.unmarshal(XStream.java:552)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.unmarshal(XStream.java:540)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.fromXML(XStream.java:497)
[java] at org.rscdaemon.server.util.PersistenceManager.load(Persistence
Manager.java:41)
[java] at org.rscdaemon.server.entityhandling.EntityHandler.(En
tityHandler.java:341)
[java] … 4 more
[java] Caused by: com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ObjectAcce
ssException: Cannot construct org.rscdaemon.server.model.InvItem as it does not
have a no-args constructor

tionProvider.newInstance(PureJavaReflectionProvider.java:50)

thats because easyrsc requires jdk 6

item.title: Java.exe not foundwut?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You have Program Files instead of Program Files (x86), from the looks of your other variables.

EDIT - looks like you fixed it yourself? cant really tell what your issue is now from the way you laid out the post

item.title: Java.exe not foundwut?
item.dc:creator: @Lemony_Lime Lemony Lime
item.description:
@Lemony_Lime wrote:

kOhrCrs.png718×161

I’ve got the environment variables set up, and it seems to literally just ignore them. I’ve followed several different tutorials, telling me to do several different things, and I’ve tried every combination of paths I can think of and nothing has worked. I’m on windows 8 (Yes, I hate it too.) is it just not compatible or something?

Compile Server.bat:

[code]ERROR: The process “java.exe” not found.
Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\li
b\tools.jar
Buildfile: build.xml

compile:
[delete] Deleting: C:\Users\Jonathan\Desktop\EasyRSC\Server - Copy\rscd.jar
[mkdir] Created dir: C:\Users\Jonathan\Desktop\EasyRSC\Server - Copy\build
[javac] Compiling 167 source files to C:\Users\Jonathan\Desktop\EasyRSC\Serv
er - Copy\build

BUILD FAILED
C:\Users\Jonathan\Desktop\EasyRSC\Server - Copy\build.xml:13: Unable to find a j
avac compiler;
com.sun.tools.javac.Main is not on the classpath.
Perhaps JAVA_HOME does not point to the JDK.
It is currently set to “C:\Program Files\Java\jre7”

Total time: 0 seconds[/code]

Run Server.bat:

[code]Buildfile: build.xml

runserver:
[java] Error: Could not find or load main class org.rscdaemon.server.Server

 [java] Java Result: 1

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 0 seconds[/code]

Read full topic
